WRD_Gale.synopsis: In this scene, we’ve gone through an elaborate protocol to bring Gale back to life. He’s obviously very glad to live again, but he realises the player will have questions for him, questions he’s not actually ready to answer.
WRD_Gale.how_to_trigger: loadlevel WLD_Main_Aoe debugbook > add Gale as companionctrl+shift+k Galecinematic will trigger, accept requestLoot Gale > pull purple thread > play flute individual notes 'D' 'E' 'A' 'D' > choose option 'ach' and give scroll.> use scroll of true revival on Gale

WRD_Gale_16.speaker: Gale
WRD_Gale_16.text: My word, you did it! Ha! Oh, it's good to be alive!
WRD_Gale_16.context: NodeContext: Enthusiastic, glad, very relieved and happy.

WRD_Gale_3.speaker: Gale
WRD_Gale_3.text: My hands are still cold so that handshake will have to wait, but in the meantime: thank you!
WRD_Gale_3.context: NodeContext: Enthusiastic, glad, very relieved and happy.

WRD_Gale_26.speaker: Gale
WRD_Gale_26.text: It's a relief to be back on beautiful Faerûn. The dreariness of the Fugue Plane oppresses one's soul so very quickly.

WRD_Gale_23.speaker: Gale
WRD_Gale_23.text: That said, I assume you have some questions for me.

WRD_Gale_48.speaker: Gale
WRD_Gale_48.text: Only fair to warn you I've precious few answers to spare.

WRD_Gale_25.speaker: Gale
WRD_Gale_25.text: I apologise if that sounds thankless. It's just that some secrets simply cannot be revealed.

WRD_Gale_28.speaker: Player
WRD_Gale_28.text: I've seen the darkness inside of you, remember? I already know.

WRD_Gale_59.speaker: Gale
WRD_Gale_59.text: You don't know. Not really. But after all you've done for me, I do suppose I should be at least a little bit forthcoming.

WRD_Gale_8.speaker: Gale
WRD_Gale_8.text: Tell you what: I will answer one question that you may have.
WRD_Gale_8.context: NodeContext: He tries his best to be magnanimous.

WRD_Gale_24.speaker: Gale
WRD_Gale_24.text: To the best of my ability.
WRD_Gale_24.context: NodeContext: But after being magnanimous he immediately lowers expectations. He’s not actually ready to give proper answers.

WRD_Gale_54.speaker: Gale
WRD_Gale_54.context: NodeContext: But after being magnanimous he immediately lowers expectations. He’s not actually ready to give proper answers.

WRD_Gale_20.speaker: Player
WRD_Gale_20.text: I simply want to know what it is you're keeping from me.

WRD_Gale_19.speaker: Gale
WRD_Gale_19.text: I am dangerous. Not because I want to be, but because of... an error I made in the past.

WRD_Gale_75.speaker: Gale
WRD_Gale_75.text: I told you how I sought to win the favour of Mystra. I did this by trying to control a form of magic only one wizard ever could.

WRD_Gale_10.speaker: Gale
WRD_Gale_10.text: I failed to control it. Instead it infested me.

WRD_Gale_13.speaker: Gale
WRD_Gale_13.text: It makes me dangerous - even in death.

WRD_Gale_21.speaker: Gale
WRD_Gale_21.text: You brought me back to life, and for that I'm in your debt, but we're surrounded by danger. It could happen again.

WRD_Gale_18.speaker: Gale
WRD_Gale_18.text: If it does, bring me back again. You must. For the sake of many.

WRD_Gale_61.speaker: Player
WRD_Gale_61.text: Why did your projection say that many lives depended on your resurrection?

WRD_Gale_53.speaker: Gale
WRD_Gale_53.text: Because it was the truth, and the truth is a great motivator.

WRD_Gale_65.speaker: Gale
WRD_Gale_65.text: When I told you I need powerful magic to keep my condition under control, I didn't tell you why. Well, here's part of the why:

WRD_Gale_45.speaker: Player
WRD_Gale_45.text: The darkness inside you, what is it?

WRD_Gale_58.speaker: Gale
WRD_Gale_58.text: It is magic  from another time and another place. It is something that is beyond me, yet inside me.

WRD_Gale_50.speaker: Gale
WRD_Gale_50.text: That makes me dangerous - even in death.

WRD_Gale_66.speaker: Player
WRD_Gale_66.text: Actually, never mind. If it makes you this uncomfortable, I won't insist.

WRD_Gale_17.speaker: Gale
WRD_Gale_17.text: That's... Well, that's very kind of you. If the roles were reversed I don't know if I'd have your patience.

WRD_Gale_67.speaker: Gale
WRD_Gale_67.text: There's no knowledge in a glimpse of darkness. My secrets are still my own.

WRD_Gale_29.speaker: Player
WRD_Gale_29.text: You told me you trusted me. Here's your chance to prove it.

WRD_Gale_4.speaker: Gale
WRD_Gale_4.text: I did say that. And I did mean it. And I do suppose that after all you've done for me, I should be at least a little bit forthcoming.

WRD_Gale_47.speaker: Gale
WRD_Gale_47.text: I do trust you. But some things... Some things are kept in the dark for good reason.

WRD_Gale_38.speaker: Player
WRD_Gale_38.text: I brought you back to life. A few answers is the least you can spare me.

WRD_Gale_70.speaker: Gale
WRD_Gale_70.text: I... I suppose that after all you've done for me, I should be at least a little bit forthcoming.

WRD_Gale_52.speaker: Gale
WRD_Gale_52.text: And yet, there's too much a few answers could undo...

WRD_Gale_55.speaker: Player
WRD_Gale_55.text: I will have answers or I will put you in the ground myself.

WRD_Gale_69.speaker: Gale
WRD_Gale_69.text: I think I've already proven I take my secrets to the grave.

WRD_Gale_7.speaker: Player
WRD_Gale_7.text: Tell me, or this'll be a very short-lived return.

WRD_Gale_39.speaker: Player
WRD_Gale_39.text: You know what? It's fine. You will tell me when you're ready.

WRD_Gale_73.speaker: Gale
WRD_Gale_73.text: Now, I believe adventure awaits. Or misadventure, perhaps. Shall we?
WRD_Gale_73.context: NodeContext: twinkle in his eye at the prospect

WRD_Gale_9.speaker: Player
WRD_Gale_9.text: Now that you're back with us, there's something else I wanted to discuss.

WRD_Gale_14.speaker: Gale
WRD_Gale_14.text: Nothing would give me greater pleasure. What's the subject of the day?

WRD_Gale_51.speaker: Player
WRD_Gale_51.text: I'd like to point out that if anything, your protocol was a bloody nuisance.

WRD_Gale_32.speaker: Gale
WRD_Gale_32.text: But a necessary one! Scrolls of True Resurrection don't grow on trees, you know.

WRD_Gale_22.speaker: Gale
WRD_Gale_22.text: Yes, I was afraid you'd say that.

WRD_Gale_12.speaker: Player
WRD_Gale_12.text: I could hardly leave you there to rot. You'd have blown up and taken me with you.

WRD_Gale_11.speaker: Gale
WRD_Gale_11.text: Quite. And I must say - I'm glad you've taken my plight to heart. I see my trust in you was most excellently placed.
